teetime.framework

Class Execution<T extends Configuration>

  • java.lang.Object
    • teetime.framework.Execution<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of the Configuration

    public final class Execution<T extends Configuration>
extends Object
    Represents an Execution to which stages can be added and executed later. This needs a Configuration, in which the adding and configuring of stages takes place. To start the analysis executeBlocking() needs to be executed. This class will automatically create threads and join them without any further commitment.
    Since:
    2.0
    Author:
    Christian Wulf, Nelson Tavares de Sousa

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Execution(T configuration)
      Creates a new Execution that skips validating the port connections and uses the default listener.
      Execution(T configuration, boolean validationEnabled)
      Creates a new Execution that uses a specific listener.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abortEventually() 
      void executeBlocking()
      This method will start this execution and block until it is finished.
      void executeNonBlocking()
      This method starts this execution without waiting for its termination.
      T getConfiguration()
      Retrieves the Configuration which was used to add and arrange all stages needed for this execution.
      void waitForTermination()
      Calling this method will block the current thread until the execution terminates.

        validationEnabled - whether or not the validation should be executed

    • Method Detail

      • waitForTermination

        public void waitForTermination()
        Calling this method will block the current thread until the execution terminates.
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if at least one exception in one thread has occurred within the execution. The exception contains the pairs of thread and throwable
        Since:
        2.0

      • abortEventually

        public void abortEventually()

      • executeBlocking

        public void executeBlocking()
        This method will start this execution and block until it is finished.
        Throws:
        ExecutionException - if at least one exception in one thread has occurred within the execution. The exception contains the pairs of thread and throwable.
        Since:
        2.0

      • executeNonBlocking

        public void executeNonBlocking()
        This method starts this execution without waiting for its termination. The method waitForTermination() must be called to unsure a correct termination of the execution.
        Since:
        2.0

      • getConfiguration

        public T getConfiguration()
        Retrieves the Configuration which was used to add and arrange all stages needed for this execution.
        Returns:
        the configuration used for this execution
